examples: "What's wrong with him?" "I'm not really sure."
I'm sure (that) I left my keys on the table.
I feel absolutely sure (that) you've made the right decision.
It now seems sure (that) the election will result in another victory for the government.
Shaun isn't sure whether/if he'll be able to come to the party or not.
Is there anything you're not sure of/about?
We arrive early to be sure of getting a good seat.
There is only one sure way (= one way that can be trusted) of finding out the truth.
I know for sure that I won't be able to go to the party.

body_content.explanation: to be very or too confident:
examples: She's become much more sure of herself since she got a job.

body_content.explanation: be confident that something is true:
examples: He said that he wasn't completely sure of his facts.

body_content.explanation: to have confidence in and trust someone:
examples: Henry has only been working for us for a short while, and we're not really sure about him yet.
She's sure to win.

body_content.explanation: to look and/or take action to be certain that something happens, is true, etc.:
examples: Make sure you lock the door when you go out.

body_content.explanation: If you have a sure knowledge or understanding of something, you know or understand it very well:
examples: I don't think he has a very sure understanding of the situation.
"Do you want to come swimming with us?" "Sure."
"Will you help me with this?" "Sure I will."
I sure am hungry.
"I can't do it!" "Sure you can. I'll help you."

body_content.explanation: said when someone has thanked you:
examples: "Thanks for helping us out." "Sure, any time."
